titlestmt.titleproper: Wagner Free Institute of Science student files 1935-1988
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Wagner Free Institute of Science student files

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. William Wagner originally offered free lectures and classes in his home and at Spring Garden Hall. He later constructed an Institute building, which opened to the public in 1865. The Institute's current programs and services include adult and children's programming offered onsite and at locations around Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains card file records of students and classes taken, from the mid 1930s to the late 1980s.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: roll books and general attendance records of the Faculty (90-030) also contains information on the Institute's student enrollment and certificates awarded.
